B1 to help someone or something out of a dangerous, harmful, or unpleasant situation: The lifeboat rescued the sailors from the sinking boat. The government has refused to rescue the company from bankruptcy.
More examplesFewer examplesThe management are putting together a plan to rescue the company.They shouted for help, but nobody came to rescue them.Six people were rescued by helicopter from a fishing boat in distress off the Cornish coast.She showed enormous courage when she rescued him from the fire.A goal just before half-time rescued the match from mediocrity.
